View

The View object wraps a canvas element and handles drawing and user interaction trhough mouse and keyboard for it. It offer means to scroll the view, find the currently visible bounds in project coordinates, or the center, both useful fo constructing artwork that should appear centered on screen.

Constructors

View(canvas)
View(canvas)

Creates a view object

    Parameters:
  • canvas: Canvas

Properties

canvas
canvas

The underlying native canvas element.

    Type:
  • HTMLCanvasElement
viewSize
viewSize

The size of the view canvas. Changing the view's size will resize it's underlying canvas.

    Type:
  • Size
bounds
bounds

The bounds of the currently visible area in project coordinates.

    Type:
  • Rectangle
size
size

The size of the visible area in project coordinates.

    Type:
  • Size
center
center

The center of the visible area in project coordinates.

    Type:
  • Point
zoom
zoom

The zoom factor by which the project coordinates are magnified.

    Type:
  • Number

Event Handlers

onFrame
onFrame

Handler function to be called on each frame of an animation.

The function receives an event object which contains information about the frame event:

event.count: the number of times the frame event was fired.

event.time: the total amount of time passed since the first frame event in seconds.

event.delta: the time passed in seconds since the last frame event.

    Type:
  • function

Example — Creating an animation:

Run
onResize
onResize

Handler function that is called whenever a view is resized.

    Type:
  • function

Example — Repositioning items when a view is resized: 

// Create a circle shaped path in the center of the view:
var path = new Path.Circle(view.bounds.center, 30);
path.fillColor = 'red';

function onResize(event) {
	// Whenever the view is resized, move the path to its center:
	path.position = view.center;
}

Methods

isVisible()
isVisible()

Checks whether the view is currently visible within the current browser viewport.

    Returns:
  • Boolean — Whether the view is visible.
scrollBy(point)
scrollBy(point)

Scrolls the view by the given vector.

    Parameters:
  • point: Point
